Reviews.Title: “Cute rooms, clean, cheap”
Reviews.Author: UKX
Reviews.Content: Rooms were nicely decorated, staff were friendly and helpful, easy drive to the old town, Fashion Valley and beach front.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Budget Accommodation in City Centre”
Reviews.Author: jsilverspice
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Rodeway, it was little chalet like rooms where we were able to park our car outside. Only a 10 minute walk from the centre of San Diego and the nightlife and restaurants which were in abundance, and 15 minutes away from the train which takes you over the Mexican border into Tiajuana. The room was spotlessly clean, and apart from the private facilities had satelite T.V, air-conditioning, and room service. You can also rent movies from the reception as there is a dvd player in your room. Staff and Manager were very freindly and helpful in giving us information to get out and about San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Stay Away from this joint in Rancho Bernardo”
Reviews.Author: MarshallGulch
Reviews.Content: I also assumed that anything in Rancho Bernardo would be fine. This place is the Pits. The "no pool" is waiting for a $25K rebuild. I don't think it will happen. There were only 3 vehicles that night. We were one. The window screen had been bent from a attempt to open it from the outside. There was a fan in the room. Didn't use it. This is absolute shelter for one night if you "can't go anywhere else" room. And at 79.00, you might as well go to Holiday Inn for 89.00 2 blocks away. We stayed one night. and it was the creeps. Yuk Dude.......We transferred to the Holiday Inn the next morning and went from the Gulag from Rodeway to the Resort of Comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Tried to save $$ - Boy was I sorry!”
Reviews.Author: scoobydoo99
Reviews.Content: As a local resident, I assumed that any hotel in Rancho Bernardo would at least be decent. WOW - I couldn't have been more wrong! Filthy grounds and rooms, broken/inoperative fixtures, MOLD in the bathroom. And please, PLEASE, don't try any of the "continental breakfast" items (OJ was dispensed as mostly water, with a little mix squirted in at the end - muffins were like little concrete blobs.) Finally, the owner/operator family constantly eyed us as we came and went and gave us the creeps. Spend the extra $40 and go down the street to the Holiday Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap rates really reflect the quality of the room”
Reviews.Author: bitmaster20
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a cheap rate in San Diego area and Rodeway Inn came up the winner. However, upon arriving in the parking lot we begin to have second thoughts. The motel looks like one of those cheap mom-and-pop outfits from the outside. The landscaping looks like it hasn't been tended to for quiet some while. Inside, the rooms were in decent condition. There was a portable fan in the room, which signaled that there was something wrong with the air conditioning. Yep, the AC did not work. Besides that, the room was clean. The swimming pool wasn't well taken care of though. Overall, for the price we paid ($80), I don't think we got a good bargain.

Reviews.Title: “No Hot Water”
Reviews.Author: MissBkay
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for three weeks for work. We work nights so our crew didn't arrive until around midnight and when we used the night window the man was very rude. The first room was nice enough with high wood cielings. But the next morning we discovered there was no hot water in the entire hotel and there hadn't been all weekend yet they continued to rent out rooms and failed to tell us until we asked Monday evening. It wasn't fixed until we came back the next week. The next hotel room had gashes in the walls, and both rooms had trash under the beds. The maids didn't come until 4 or 5pm and when we asked for service earlier in the morning and they agreed they still were not there until 6pm! They also spilled a bag I had in the room and failed to pick it up. The vending machine doesn't give you what you want sometimes and you have to buy something twice to actually get it. It is rarely restocked. One of our microwaves didn't work and the central air doesn't either so personal fans were brought to us! IN SAN DIEGO- NO AC! Plus, the lights hardly ever worked. There wasn't a clock in one of the rooms. They failed to give us our wake up call. And there was not enough wall sockets for the fridge, microwave, clock when we had it, and TV, and light all to be plugged in at once. It was ridiculous. There were only one large towel, for the pool, a bath towel, a facial towel, and a hand towel- for a double room! The water pressure is really bad, as well. The pool was dirty and is placed next to a tree that leaves fall from into the pool in all types of weather. Basically, if my boss didn't pay for this I would have walked away the first night.

Reviews.Title: “Not great, not really bad.”
Reviews.Author: omer66
Reviews.Content: This is located in a very quiet place, and is quite easy to get to from the freeway. It needed better cleaning, but was clean enough where it counted. The carpet was new, and everything we needed was there, including wireless connection to the internet. For the price, I think it was the best we could find. 2 months before we paid the same for a city motel 8, and it was a horrible experience, even though that motel was cleaner than this one. Overall, if you're looking for a deal, don't pass this one up.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy and disgusting. Don't walk barefoot!”
Reviews.Author: jmoneil
Reviews.Content: Let me preface this by saying that we weren't expecting a 4-star resort. We were in the market for a budget-friendly family motel, nothing fancy, no frills. However, we did expect our room to be clean and habitable. At first glance, our room appeared neat, though it was obviously not a luxury suite. Then we noticed that the ceiling above the bathtub was cracked and peeling, and black mildewy pieces had fallen into the tub, making a bath undesirable. Since our infant and 5-year-old don't take showers, we realized this would be a problem during our stay, but at that point we still figured we could manage. We settled in a bit, and let our crawling infant play with his toys on the floor. Shortly afterwards, we saw that his knees, feet and hands were black with grime from the carpet. Yes, black. There's no telling what was in that carpet to make him so dirty in such a short period of time. We checked out the following morning and found a different hotel for the remainder of our stay. The front desk staff claimed that the carpets are steam cleaned every three weeks, but we suspect that our room was not part of that schedule. We would not recommend this hotel to anyone with small children, people with allergies, or anyone who would simply rather not sleep in filth.
